column4: has anybody here been able to make vnc connections from Windows to Linux?
I can make connections from Windows to Windows, and Linux to windows... but when i try to go from windows to linux i just get a terminal type screen
ok, so probably samba then. you mean to view files like they were local to the machine?
you are probably using vnc then
you should make sure that the programs you are using are all compatible, also, make sure compiz/beryl is not running on the linux box as they are generally not compatible with vnc
you can also try ms terminal services, that is quite efficient and there is free software support for it in ubuntu although the server is not there to be set up by default afaik
tightvnc is good, are the port settings on the server and clients all the same?
and also the server(s) are set to accept incoming connections
maybe you set it wrongly on one of them?
you should be able to, take a look at the command line options
which is it that wont connect?
yes, i gatherd that. best to get rid of all the possibilities though
i did say, disable beryl and compiz :)
